page.title: 08The Conservation Centre
page.content: We went to Newton St. Loe and interviewed Mr.Dave Adams of the British Trust for Conservation volunteers which is a registered charity which combines people, tools and equipment. The Newton centre is the H.Q. for the whole of the west of England. Mr.Dave Adams showed us all round the building and grounds. He showed us the offices, kitchens, showers and dormatories where people stay. We tried some of the wild strawberries from the conservation area and found them rather bitter. He showed us the tool shed which contained 200-300 tools which cost Â£4-5000. The conservation volunteers plant trees, manage woodland put up stiles and keep footpaths clear and repair dry stone walls and other things like that.
